name: Wizardry 8
summary: Sir-Tech went out big with Wizardry 8. Gamers had to wait nearly ten years after playing Wizardry 7 before they got their hands on this last title in the series' history. Given all the changes that took place in the RPG genre during those ten years, we could forgive Wizardry 8 for being defiantly old school, but the team managed to create a game that was at once both familiar and original. One of the best aspects of the setting is that it mixes magic and high technology. Seeing dwarves and magic swords side by side with androids and laser pistols may have turned off purists, but it allowed Wizardry 8 to tell a story on a truly galactic scale. Players found themselves aspiring to become gods and rewrite the destiny of the entire universe. Next to that, killing dragons and saving princesses seems positively quaint.
